name: Sheraton Garden Grove - Anaheim South Hotel

reviews.text: Our family of three stayed here for 3 nights. I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland, although we only planned one very full day at Disneyland, and because it had a good rating on Trip Advisor. We always stay at Disney hotels when going to Disney World in Florida, but in Anaheim with Disneyland, there are no well-priced resorts on property, just Deluxe resorts with Deluxe prices. I am a Gold member of the Sheraton Starwood group, so I looked here.
reviews.title: Average stay, good price for Disneyland area

reviews.text: We started off at this hotel at almost midnight, as we flew in from the middle of the country. We were told that the elevators were broken and that they were giving us a fifth floor room. We had 5-6 pieces of luggage with us....but no offer of help to get us up to that room. I had to ask! Already not happy as a Gold member of their Starwood program with this happening. Fortunately the girl at the desk found a very nice kid who helped us get up there using their freight elevator, so we didn't have to lug our luggage up five flights of stairs.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good, better than the reviews implied.

reviews.text: In addition, we chose self-parking ($12 a night) but they had very few self-parking spots. The valet parked our car instead, for no additional parking fee. Of course, then you have to tip them for a service you really didn't want. I actually find it ridiculous when you have to pay to park at a hotel where you are already paying to spend the night. This seems to be the standard in the Disneyland area.
reviews.title: A Hotel Fit for Mickey Mouse

reviews.text: So far, two disappointments before we even get to the room. The room was clean and as expected size-wise. Beds were OK, not as good as those at Westin properties. Because we would use the hotel just for breakfast and sleeping, I didn't search for a larger room. Our package allowed breakfast for two, even though there were three of us. That always seems strange, but we went with it.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure!!!

reviews.text: There is a Target across the (busy) street from the hotel. They had Disneyland souvenirs at the front of the store for discounted prices. The police decided to set up a car check road block right in front of the hotel on one night of our stay, so there were flashing lights at the road block until the wee hours of the morning. I expect this disturbed those who had lower level rooms.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel Near Disney

reviews.text: I am a loyal Starwood customer and I have to say that the Sheraton Garden Grove is a despicable representation of the Starwood group of hotels.
reviews.title: This review is long winded but it's worth it!

reviews.text: My 10 night booking was completed through Priceline 4 months in advance. I called the hotel directly to make my request for 2 queen size beds and my request was taken.
reviews.title: Second class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fast forward 4 months to check in time. I was received with the most unhelpful people I have ever encountered in my life. My 2 queen size bed room request was discarded because I was a Priceline customer. Apparently, staying at the Sheraton does not automatically qualify me as a Sheraton customer. The fact that I frequent the Westin, am a Starwood Preferred Guest does not resonate at the Sheraton. I suppose because I purchased a room at a Priceline rate, they felt they should get the money back that they lost by selling off inventory to Priceline. I was offered a rollaway cot for $20 a night. Then it was an additional $15 for parking/internet/shuttle.
reviews.title: Good quick stay

reviews.text: I asked to speak to the Manager who did not feel a timely response was in order and did not contact me until my next issue arose hours later.
reviews.title: Keep looking for another hotel

reviews.text: On to the next issue…
reviews.title: Clean Hotel & Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a typical cookie-cutter Sheraton. I have seen many of the exact same design. Front desk service was ok. Two people working check-in, but one was busy doing something else. In my opinion, don't be at the front desk if you are not going to be checking people in.
reviews.title: Nice stay for Disneyland

reviews.text: Even though we were supposed to get a room upgrade, we were in one of the smallet rooms on the property. Room was nice with a great shower. Pool kind of small, but the water temperature was nice. Target is across the street. Some nice restaurants very close (Red Robin, Cocos, Joe's Crab Shack, etc.). We had access to the club lounge which gave us a nice breakfast in the morning and ok snacks at night. A little overpriced for location and amenities.
reviews.title: Good Price but not typical

reviews.text: We chose to drive to the Disneyland parking lot and take the Disney shuttle. Parking there is $15. The hotel shuttle is only $4 round trip, and doesn't take as long. Next time, we will take the hotel shuttle.
reviews.title: Another great Starwood hotel

reviews.text: Elevators made a lot of noises, almost sounded like they were being worked on.
reviews.title: Rocio Corona should not be employed in customer service.

reviews.text: Overall, a very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Still has some kinks to work out, but very nice

reviews.text: You know when you book a room and it asks you how many children and their ages so it can provide you a room that will accomodate your family? Well that's just for show at this hotel. But that was just the beginning...
reviews.title: No room for customer service or a family of 5

reviews.text: We booked this room through a third party hotel search company that billed the room as accommodating 5 people. When I checked in, the front desk person told me it was a room with 2 queens. I asked for a roll away and she said she couldn't put a roll away in that room because it was a fire hazard. I told her that I booked a room for 5. She said it would sleep 5 if I put one of my children on the floor. Let me repeat that stunning recommendation..'put a child on the floor'. I checked the sign on the door again. This is a Sheraton, right? In name only it appears. I asked her for a room that could sleep 5 'on beds'. She said they didn't have any. At this point I asked to speak to the manager and much to my surprise! She was the manager. I asked her why they would sell me a room advertised as sleeping 5 when it doesn't. She said it would be up to me to figure out the sleeping arrangements. 'Up to me', the customer. Her responses were so smug and lacked such empathy that I asked to speak to her manager and wouldn't you know it, he wouldn't be back until tomorrow.
reviews.title: Second Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "What time tomorrow?" I ask.
reviews.title: Best Stay Ever!!!

reviews.text: "I don't know" she responds without lifting her eyes from the floor.
reviews.title: My Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "Your management doesn't have a schedule?", I inquire.
reviews.title: Best Sheraton in the Anaheim area

reviews.text: We stayed at this Sheraton from June 17-20th. The service at the front desk was friendly and efficient, however better value and amenities along with equally good accommodations are easily available elsewhere in the area. The rooms are good sized and very comfortable. Huge bathroom! No closet or hanging space however, but instead a free standing wardrobe /amoire which limits you in closet space. Difficult when not traveling alone. This property is more”resorty” and appears that it caters to business travelers more than families visiting Disney. There are extra charges for everything which are common at most other establishments in the area (despite what the management says) such as in room fridge and wifi. Items such as fridge and/or microwave are essential when traveling with young children and cost the company next to nothing to provide, yet they really stick you for the daily cost. Free wifi is available if you want to use their services in the lobby, allbeit extremely slow, however it is $10/day for wifi service in your room. Really??? That is ridiculous. No breakfast is included with your stay here as in most family oriented establishments today, particularly in the Disney area. Breakfast is available however for preferred SWG members at the “Club” and also for a price in the lobby restaurant which was less than desirable. The Donut/Pastry shop down the street was great! We stayed here ONLY because it had been pre booked and pre paid with Disney tickets through an outside travel company, otherwise we would have left after the first night. As our stay continued for four nights we learned a few other things. Housekeeping is very busy and often forgets to restock your room with clean towels and glasses. We also found a dirty Q-tip on the floor underneath the desk when we arrived…..apparently too busy for thorough vacuuming too. The shuttle to Disney was outstanding and works very hard to be accommodating. The shuttle employees were always very prompt and courteous. This establishment does not cater to families whatsoever. . It would be a great value if booked through an online booking company for a reduced price, but definitely not worth paying their “market” price. We heard great reviews on the shuttle from other families in nearby properties where we will go next time. This visit was a huge disappointment and we will not be recommending it to others nor will we be returning when in the area again. Shame on you, Sheraton!
reviews.title: Overpriced and Overrated.....NEVER again!
It was great
reviews.text: time.

I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove. Rooms were large - I was there by myself, but it would have been fine with my family for a few nights. The entire hotel was clean and well maintained. Staff was very friendly. The fitness room was not large, but adequately equipped with free weights, mats, exercise balls, plus treadmills, stationary bikes and ellipticals. I could see the pool, and it seemed a bit small.
reviews.title: Not so happy customer.

reviews.text: The downsides for me were that there was no fridge in the room, at least not for an extra charge. There were computers in the lobby, but they could be slow. Also, there were some noise issues in the room. When my neighbors showered it was very loud, and they showered very early in the morning before I had to be awake, but awake I was. I could also hear them talking in their room - muffled, but I could still hear it. Also, the view. All I could see was the hotel's air conditioning units, duct work, etc. I don't know how to get around that because it has to go somewhere, and I was out all day so it really didn't matter, but it was kind of dismal.
reviews.title: Typical Sheraton

reviews.text: I have stayed at several hotels (Hilton, Ayres, DoubleTree) near Disneyland in the past year and this is the worst one. Unfortunately, I used to book through Hotwire and this was rated as a 3.5+ star hotel. In my opinion it's not even a 3 star. I had the bad fortune of ending up at this hotel twice before deciding I will never again book through Hotwire without knowing the hotel, and I will make my best efforts to avoid Sheraton.
reviews.title: This is not a 3 star hotel. Shuttle Service is sketchy from this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's start with the good points:
reviews.title: Go to the Hyatt Garden Grove

reviews.text: 1) Near Disneyland
reviews.title: Sheraton Garden Grove delivers a GREAT stay again!

reviews.text: 2) Rooms are pretty clean
reviews.title: Discourtesy in Disney

reviews.text: 3) Price is okay
reviews.title: Easy to get to but not my favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having stayed 28 days in the past two month in another Sheraton I can tell you that this location is a lot better. It is worth the extra money to stay on the top floor in a club room. The nightly snack was very tasty and the breakfast was also good. There is an espresso machine for use but I don't think that it makes very good drinks. If you are going to Disney you have to pay for the shuttle which stops outside every half hour. The times did not work for us so we just drove the 1.5 miles.
reviews.title: Club lounge was nice

reviews.text: While we had a good stay, and room was reasonably priced, we had a baby and toddler and this hotel seems much more geared towards a biz traveler than families. The pool is small. No bathtub in our room and to get a shuttle to Disney or California Adventure, you have to go out back behind hotel to wait. Why is it so hard to pick up/drop off at front lobby area?! I worked at a Starwood hotel in past and we were supposed to be very kind, helpful to guests...this hotel staff seemed pretty fair, but not gushing. The housekeepers were the nicest, though. Also, If we didn't get our upgrade to the Club level, I think we would of been disappointed. At Club level you got a free refrigerator. And breakfast and happy hour appetizers. With two small kids, free breakfast and a frig mean a lot.
reviews.title: Going to Disney? Unless you are a Starwood member or have older kids, not best option around.

reviews.text: The room was very nice. We had to block off baby's pack-n-play in a corner with armoire so he had a little area to himself. But no bathtub. Ugh.
reviews.title: Lower tier Starwood chain
Nothing fancy but just fine
reviews.text: If you go to the parks, suck it up, pay a few extra bucks and go to a more family-friendly place near Disney. On Business or have older kids and want your Starwood Points...stay here.

The Sheraton name used to mean quality but this is no longer the case. Judging from the few Sheratons I've stayed in recently including Garden Grove, the Sheraton is the runt of the litter in the Starwood family. Customer service including the front desk, reservations office both corporate and local, and management was subpar. The room itself was large but reeked and I had to spray the entire room including curtains, carpets and bed spreads with febreze ($4.99 at the target across the street). There were also hairs in the bathtub. I did check for bed bugs and found none. Considering this hotel was rated a 3 1/2 star property on both priceline and hotwire, the amenities were few and far between and not worthy of this rating. Don't believe the ratings on 3rd party sites. Check the AAA site for more accurate reviews and ratings. I requested for an upgrade both in advance and upon arrival (which I was more than happy to pay for) and was told there was nothing available. However when I checked on line there was availability. Another example of Priceline customers being treated unfairly. I did notice that the daily rate for the tour groups was $49.00 per night (lower than my priceline rate) (I knew the rate because the bills were all laying outside the doors of the tour guests and not shoved under the door like most hotels do. I checked the rate on the folios. Given that the folios have personal information such as name and address of the guests, the Sheraton should be a little more carful and protect this private information.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, near to Disney and Target

reviews.text: Our family stayed over a busy holiday weekend, and had a great time. The room was nice and big with a large window to bring in plenty of light. The breakfast we got was good, although it was hard finding seating because of the holiday weekend.
reviews.title: Nice place, good location

reviews.text: It is very close to "The Mouse" and restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great value, better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My kids spent several hours in the pool and hot tub, although since there were a lot of people visiting I think the hot tub or pool chlorine was off because my daughters hair was a little on the green side when they were done. I think it was the hot tub since there was a lot of foam in it (never seen a hot tub like that before).
reviews.title: Great as ever.
BEWARE PET POLICY
reviews.text: Newer Sheraton hotel, room was very nice, better than expected. Great value and close to Disneyland.

Great quiet rooms, large bath, club lounge is totally worth the extra $. Can't figure out why others feel this place isn't perfect, except maybe for the parking free ($12), but all the other hotels nearby charge the same or more anyhow, so what's the big deal. Plus, people are always complaining about it being too far from the park and yet they have a car and complain about the parking fee. so take the car for hell's sake and skip the shuttle.
reviews.title: You've Done It Again!

description: Step outside and enjoy the nearby attractions. The Sheraton Garden Grove is only 1.5 miles away from the laughs and screams at Disneyland, and the variety of shops at Downtown Disney.
